clinical_study.official_title: Prehabilitation to Enhance Functional Capacity in Esophageal Cancer Care

lead_sponsor.agency: McGill University Health Centre/Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre

clinical_study.source: McGill University Health Centre/Research Institute of the McGill University Health Centre

brief_summary.textblock: Prehabilitation utilizes the preoperative period to prevent or attenuate the treatment-related functional decline and its consequences. This project aims at testing feasibility and effectiveness of multimodal prehabilitation in esophageal cancer care.

detailed_description.textblock:
While evidence on prehabilitation is mounting, upper gastrointestinal surgery still remains under-investigated. This trial aims to explore the effect of prehabilitation over the whole perioperative trajectory, including neo-adjuvant treatment (NAT).
Multimodal prehabilitation includes exercise, nutrition therapy, and mental distress coping strategies. In the context of a multimodal approach, the two groups follow different exercise prescriptions: high-intensity interval supervised training prescribed accordingly cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPET)-derived variables, versus a home-based program. For both groups, multimodal prehabilitation is prescribed over the whole preoperative period, including during NAT.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 2 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Oxygen consumption at anaerobic threshold (VO2 at AT) measured with cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPET)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to post neo-adjuvant therapy (average duration 6-8 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Oxygen consumption at anaerobic threshold (VO2 at AT) measured with cardiopulmonary exercise testing (CPET)

arm_group.description: Prehabilitation will include exercise, nutrition, and anxiety-coping intervention. This group will receive a supervised, in-hospital training.
Prehabilitation will include exercise, nutrition, and anxiety-coping intervention. This group will receive a home-based training.

intervention.description: Endurance and Resistance Exercise, Nutrition therapy, reducing intervention during the whole preoperative period

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with non-metastatic esophageal cancer undergoing neo-adjuvant chemotherapy and surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- co-morbid medical, physical and mental conditions that contraindicate exercise or oral nutrition
